frame.name: Health_response
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> is sensitive to a <fen>Trigger</fen>, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Protagonist">Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary</fex> <m>are</m> <t>allergic</t> <fex name="Trigger">to cats</fex>.</ex>
<ex>On top of this, <fex name="Protagonist">he</fex> <m>has</m> <t>allergies</t> <fex name="Trigger">to oats and dust</fex> and is a finicky feeder.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Pat's</fex> <t>allergy</t> <fex name="Trigger">to dairy products</fex> is severe.</ex> <ex><fex name="Protagonist">Young children</fex> are very <t>susceptible</t> <fex name="Trigger">to infections</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Trigger
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Some people</fex> are very <t>sensitive</t> <fex name="Trigger">to chemicals in the environment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Manner</fen> describes the way (or style) in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> Health_response manifests itself.
<ex>Different socio-economic groups , age-groups , ethnic groups , genders have different needs for medical services because of their <fex name="Manner">differing</fex> <t>susceptibility</t> and experience of morbidity and accidents.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> describes the extent to which the health response occurs.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Jake</fex> is <fex name="Degree">extremely</fex> <t>allergic</t> <fex name="Trigger">to codeine</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">Grass and clover seeds</fex> need fairly warm conditions for germination and are <fex name="Degree">more</fex> <t>sensitive</t> <fex name="Trigger">to drought or excessive moisture</fex> <fex name="Degree">than cereals.</fex></ex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body that is responding to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
<ex>Diabetics may have increased <fex name="BodP">vascular</fex> <t>sensitivity</t> to angiotensin II</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: allergic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, caused by, or relating to an allergy.

lexUnit.name: allergy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a damaging immune response by the body to a substance to which it has become hypersensitive

lexUnit.name: sensitive.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: quick to be affected by slight changes or influences

lexUnit.name: sensitivity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the quality or condition of being sensitive to slight changes or influences

lexUnit.name: susceptible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: likely to be influenced or harmed by a particular thing

lexUnit.name: susceptibility.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: likelihood of being influenced or harmed by a particular thing
